{"step_by_step_thinking": "Chimerism is a condition where an individual has two or more genetically distinct types of cells in their body. This can occur naturally, such as when two fertilized eggs fuse together, or it can be induced, such as through organ transplantation. In the case of organ transplantation, the recipient's body may contain cells from both their own original organ and the transplanted organ, leading to a state of chimerism. Therefore, chimerism is most directly associated with organ transplantation.", "answer_choice": "D"}
